# The `SelectionDAGTargetInfo` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Targets can subclass this to parameterize the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> lowering and instruction selection process. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::SelectionDAGTargetInfo</CodeBlock>

</IncludesList>

## Description {#details}

Targets can subclass this to parameterize the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> lowering and instruction selection process.

Definition at line 31 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h">SelectionDAGTargetInfo.h</a>.

### EmitTargetCodeForMemchr() {#a7421121667c86338edabcd58422fc0de}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual std::pair&lt; SDValue, SDValue &gt; llvm::SelectionDAGTargetInfo::EmitTargetCodeForMemchr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Src, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Char, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Length, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> SrcPtrInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a memchr, in cases where that is faster than a libcall.

The first returned <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> is the result of the memchr and the second is the chain. Both SDValues can be null if a normal libcall should be used.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h/#l00120">120</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h">SelectionDAGTargetInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### EmitTargetCodeForMemcmp() {#a4516852c8aca6ffe73e55e46f57e343f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual std::pair&lt; SDValue, SDValue &gt; llvm::SelectionDAGTargetInfo::EmitTargetCodeForMemcmp (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op3, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> Op1PtrInfo, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> Op2PtrInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a memcmp/bcmp, in cases where that is faster than a libcall.

The first returned <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> is the result of the memcmp and the second is the chain. Both SDValues can be null if a normal libcall should be used.

</MemberDefinition>

### EmitTargetCodeForMemcpy() {#a67bbb4792405a5b68e5802e46549afd6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual SDValue llvm::SelectionDAGTargetInfo::EmitTargetCodeForMemcpy (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op3, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, bool isVolatile, bool AlwaysInline, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> DstPtrInfo, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> SrcPtrInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a memcpy.

This can be used by targets to provide code sequences for cases that don&#39;t fit the target&#39;s parameters for simple loads/stores and can be more efficient than using a library call. This function can return a null <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> if the target declines to use custom code and a different lowering strategy should be used.

If AlwaysInline is true, the size is constant and the target should not emit any calls and is strongly encouraged to attempt to emit inline code even if it is beyond the usual threshold because this intrinsic is being expanded in a place where calls are not feasible (e.g. within the prologue for another call). If the target chooses to decline an AlwaysInline request here, legalize will resort to using simple loads and stores.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h/#l00064">64</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h">SelectionDAGTargetInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### EmitTargetCodeForMemmove() {#a4caafbad4d4d744ef029e7306ce6f0ce}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual SDValue llvm::SelectionDAGTargetInfo::EmitTargetCodeForMemmove (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op3, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, bool isVolatile, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> DstPtrInfo, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> SrcPtrInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a memmove.

This can be used by targets to provide code sequences for cases that don&#39;t fit the target&#39;s parameters for simple loads/stores and can be more efficient than using a library call. This function can return a null <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> if the target declines to use custom code and a different lowering strategy should be used.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h/#l00080">80</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h">SelectionDAGTargetInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### EmitTargetCodeForMemset() {#a40967b1d1d4b4759d47d044e2d30da5c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual SDValue llvm::SelectionDAGTargetInfo::EmitTargetCodeForMemset (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op3, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, bool isVolatile, bool AlwaysInline, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> DstPtrInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a memset.

This can be used by targets to provide code sequences for cases that don&#39;t fit the target&#39;s parameters for simple stores and can be more efficient than using a library call. This function can return a null <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> if the target declines to use custom code and a different lowering strategy should be used. Note that if AlwaysInline is true the function has to return a valid <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h/#l00094">94</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h">SelectionDAGTargetInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### EmitTargetCodeForSetTag() {#ad1cfa2c033245a06d51970733bc1a610}

<MemberDefinition

### EmitTargetCodeForStrcmp() {#a947e39cc695af597abaa0346c49f78a7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual std::pair&lt; SDValue, SDValue &gt; llvm::SelectionDAGTargetInfo::EmitTargetCodeForStrcmp (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op2, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> Op1PtrInfo, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> Op2PtrInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a strcmp, in cases where that is faster than a libcall.

The first returned <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> is the result of the strcmp and the second is the chain. Both SDValues can be null if a normal libcall should be used.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h/#l00145">145</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h">SelectionDAGTargetInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### EmitTargetCodeForStrcpy() {#a65ab13bbeee8f7d42c34cce961e1a5cf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual std::pair&lt; SDValue, SDValue &gt; llvm::SelectionDAGTargetInfo::EmitTargetCodeForStrcpy (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; DL, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Dest, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Src, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> DestPtrInfo, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> SrcPtrInfo, bool isStpcpy) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a strcpy or stpcpy, in cases where that is faster than a libcall.

The first returned <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> is the result of the copy (the start of the destination string for strcpy, a pointer to the null terminator for stpcpy) and the second is the chain. Both SDValues can be null if a normal libcall should be used.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h/#l00133">133</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h">SelectionDAGTargetInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isTargetMemoryOpcode() {#a3c0c3b26a895016d5ee61ee67b858e1c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual bool llvm::SelectionDAGTargetInfo::isTargetMemoryOpcode (unsigned Opcode) const"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Returns true if a node with the given target-specific opcode has a memory operand.

Nodes with such opcodes can only be created with <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag/#ae6cc63109335eefe2c5727d1e12fc820">SelectionDAG::getMemIntrinsicNode</a></code>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h/#l00041">41</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondagtargetinfo-h">SelectionDAGTargetInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Returns true if a node with the given target-specific opcode has strict floating-point semantics.
